title: (x) Slab serif font - various {gang}
content: Can anyone suggest a heavy slab serif which is contemporary and a bit different?
author: anonymous

comments.content:
I haven't figured out how to add a smiley yet. It took me months to learn how to add html to the links...   
   
I have a book cover which appears to have Clarendon Italic on it - which I know does not exist. I tracked it down finally to [Belizio](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/belizio/).
I was going to suggest Officina, but it isn't very chunky and also it's rather condensed.

Have you considered Dispatch from Font Bureau? It's a contemporary slab with extended weights.   
   
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font\_frames.tpl?cart=10930160458795601&fontname=Dispatch](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=10930160458795601&fontname=Dispatch)
I really dig Storm's [Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/farao/black/charmap.html), though the letters "ICE" don't really showcase all its coolness.
And if you're really stymied... you can always try [Stymie.](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/stymie/)

wasn't what i was searching for, but very nice:   
 [Sutro](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.typedesign.com/fontlist08.html) by Jim Parkinson.   
   
Another sleek one:   
 [FF Zine Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/zine-slab/)   
   
Okay, I think I found what I was searching for, something a bit more crystaline befitting of the word ICE:   
 [Acropolis](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/typography.com/catalog/acropolis/index.html) by HF&J   
I especially love the italic of this one.

BINGO! Glad I could tune in to yer wavelength there and help you out. Very good choice, if i must say so myself.   
   
P.S. This turned out to be quite the nice little reference list, didn't it?   
   
P.P.S. It's H&FJ, sorry guys. \*blushing\*

Ooooh, many, but I'll restrict myself to a couple of lesser known options.   
   
 [Oxtail](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_oxtail.html) is subtly different, a contemporary take on Clarendon.   
   
 [Fantabular](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.mvbfonts.com/html/fonts/fantabular/pk_fantabular.htm) is monospaced, which opens up a lot of design possibilities.   
   
 [Silica](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/html_pages/SilicaOverview.html) is an often overlooked little gem by Sumner Stone.   
   
 [ApexSerif](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/thirstype.com/fonts.php?font=ApexSerif) is so contemporary it hurts. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
 [Charifa](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=255) is very geometric, inspired by Bauhaus.   
   
 [Aminta](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=789) is a re-interpretation of the typewriter style.   
   
 [Barbera](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=570) is nice'n'quirky.   
   
 [Aurea Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=452&dw=237) has only one weight, but with a killer italic.   
   
Tell me if you need more options.

Thanks. Some nice faces there, but not quite what I'm after. It's for a magazine masthead and I'm trying to find a face that will stretch the letters 'ICE' across an A4 without going too deep into the page. Was looking for something like Aachen but with more character any other inspired ideas??

Now I know what you're looking for I'd like to suggest [Adore](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/garagefonts.com/detail.html?sku=GF05301709P2)  
by Pieter van Rosmalen.

> 
> Yves, that Oxtail is really nice!\<!-/quote-!\>

It is, isn't it? It's got everything Clarendon has plus a few bonusses,   
and it sports beautiful italics. [Stefan Hattenbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.macrhino.com/) is preparing a new   
website which will showcase all of his type designs, regardless of   
who's publishing them (he has fonts distributed by [Psy/Ops](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.psyops.com/html/info.html) and [Veer](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?RM=1&RF=1&CD=0&resultsperpage=24&page=1&producttype=TYP&keyword=hattenbach&include=&exclude=&vendor=&origPage=-1),   
and until recently [Fountain](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.fountain.nu/index.asp) and [Garage Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/garagefonts.com/)). It sure is worth checking   
out!

Coming from you, there was not a shade of doubt about your intentions.   
You're one of the few persons who can post such a comment without   
adding a smiley. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Nice font, but needs to be more chunky - Belizio is rather nice, but still a little too traditional. Looking more to Officina Serif at the moment.
Thanks everyone - going for Acropolis - exactly what I was after!

If it's just those 3 letters and a magazine masthead I'd say why not draw them yourself?   
   
Also look at [Base 12](http://web.archive.org/web/20100220210827/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PBaSeB.html).   
   
Yves, that Oxtail is really nice! Know where I can get a free version? (just kidding)
